meanings.definition: To give incorrect advice or guidance.
meanings.sent1: She misadvised her friend on the best route to take.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misadvise others when they seek help.
meanings.sent3: The misadvised directions led them to a dead-end.
meanings.sent4: His misadvised decisions caused him to get lost in the city.
meanings.sent5: Misadvising in such a critical situation could have serious consequences.

meanings.sent1: Following the misadvise led to a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent2: Receiving misadvise can sometimes be more harmful than no advice at all.
meanings.sent3: The misadvise from the unreliable source left them stranded.
meanings.sent4: The misadvise acted as a roadblock to their success.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of the misadvise were evident in their failed project.
